questions.question_text:
You create a customer journey to send an Event registration Invite to a segment of customers in a specific country/region. You confirm that you selected the correct Marketing Email record with the correct language, and that you are using the correct Segment while creating the customer journey.

As part of going live with your customer journey, you select Check for Errors in the command bar.

Which three checks does this command perform? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

You have created an outbound journey. After making the customer journey live, you receive this notification on the customer journey:

“There are work items to recover. Check the recovery items tab.”

You need to resolve this issue, but you do not have system administrator privileges.

If you report this error to a system administrator, which two actions are available to resolve the issue? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.C: The system administrator can fix the issue and recover any item, which will replay the previously failed functionality.
choices.B: The system administrator can fix the issue and replay any item, which will replay the previously failed functionality.
choices.A: After selecting rows in the Recovery Items tab, the system administrator can delete the items.
choices.D: After selecting rows in the Recovery Items tab, the system administrator can review the items and fix the issue.

discussion.content:
Based on docs, I would say A+C.
"After selecting rows in the Recovery items tab, you can delete the items (which will delete them from blob storage), or you can fix the issue and "recover" any item, which will replay the previously failed functionality."
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/journeys/customer-journey-recovery-items
